description: From Latin aster, from Ancient Greek ἀστήρ (astḗr). Doublet of star, stella, étoile, and estoile.

entries.meaning: Any of several plants of the genus Aster; one of its flowers.
examples: On a sunny September morning, with the trees still green, but the asters and fleabanes already taking over in ditch and dalk, Van set out for Ladoga, N.A.

entries.meaning: (biology) A star-shaped structure formed during the mitosis of a cell.

examples: by the changes and enter-caprings of which, the revolutions, motions, cadences, and carrols of the asters [translating astres] and planets are caused and transported.
